alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 4:27AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CURRITUCK ...THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE AND THE CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH THROUGH 500 AM EST... At 426 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Virginia Beach to near Northwest. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach, Chesapeake, Back Bay, and Northwest around 430 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Oceana, Rudee Heights, Mount Pleasant, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, North Virginia Beach, Dam Neck, Oceana NAS, Munden, and Macons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
